body:
Sorry for the delay. I think it's a bit harder to read this way. If `x_is_dict` then you have a list, which never has a `value` attr. It's only in the latter case that you need to check for value. So I think the cases are:

* `x_is_dict`
* else
    * shape has a value attr
    * shape doesn't

In general, I think you want to use `is_tensor` from `tensor_utils.py` rather than checking for the attr.

  • x_is_dict
  • else

    • shape doesn't

In general, I think you want to use is_tensor from tensor_utils.py rather than checking for the attr.
